reviews.text: You may have guessed from the title that I didn't think much of the location of this hotel. The modern hotel next to the derelict looking carpark was depressing. Upon arrival the receptionist was very helpful and polite and upgraded me to a studio suite. It honestly went downhill from there. The room was modern and functional except for the television. The government have been advertising the switchover from analogue to digital for years but apparently they weren't aware of it at the hotel. This meant that everybody was lucky if they got one or two very snowy channels at most. The excuse of the gentleman (perhaps the manager) behind the reception was that he had only been in the UK a few months so didn't know about the switchover. Even if the TV had worked, it was situated between the seating area and the bedroom area. You couldn't rotate it so it was impossible to view from the bed - in fact it almost faced the wall inbetween the two areas of the room. Bizarre planning I have to say.
reviews.title: Wrong location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a business hotel, it was disappointing to not have WiFi except on the ground and first floor. They explained that they have a keyboard and ethernet connection in the room however this is no use to smartphone and iPad users. There were a lot of complaints about this from people staying for a conference. Highly inconvenient and unacceptable in this day and age.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lift was the slowest I have ever encountered which was very mildly annoying. The fitness room was a shambles. It was tiny with hardly any equipment and the running machine simply was not fit for purpose. It kept slipping and in my opinion was quite dangerous.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience, worth repeating

reviews.text: Service at breakfast was poor. When a neighbouring table asked for some milk they simply picked up my colleagues milk off our table. When within a few seconds he asked for replacement milk they just pointed to the cereal area and told him to help himself. Most of the hot breakfast food was drowning in fat and the scrambled eggs were a lumpen mess sitting in liquid. I am not even sure how such inedible eggs had been "created" - I won't even use the word "cooked".
reviews.title: Excellent food and service

reviews.text: The highlight of my stay hear was when I was able to leave. Next time I will stay at the Premier Inn which is in the centre of town and fellow conference members gave it a thumbs up.
reviews.title: Shameful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights over the bank holiday weekend. After reading reviews on here i decided to email to see if they could allocate us a high up room an upon check-in thats exactly what we got! They even upgraded us to a 'studio' and we were on the 16th floor with amazing views!
reviews.title: Best hotel in Coventry

reviews.text: I cant comment on the standard double which we paid for becuase we were in a studio...the bed was cozy, good pillows and duvet, small seperate lounge area which was handy and plenty of desk/wardrobe space. Large bathroom and huge double power shower with freebie toiletries.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!! in everyway.

reviews.text: We didnt eat in the hotel for breakfast or in the evening so cannot coment on food but within 20 foot steps of the hotel there are about 5 Indian restaurants, 1 Thai, a cheap pub and a cafe. Also a few takeaways and a Spar type shop, there is also a big Ikea opposite the hotel & a complex with iceskating and a cinema inside which was handy. Centre of coventry and the cathedral etc are about 5-10min walk...as with most hotels in the area.
reviews.title: trying to be clever and dishonest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not a great deal to see or do in Coventry, we seen everything we wanted to within an afternoon but Warwick and Strattford-Upon-Avon are within 15-20min drives away and most definately worth visiting!
reviews.title: Hard to find entrance to Car Park

reviews.text: Would certainly stay here again, hotel looks as though its had a complete re-furb within last couple of years, everything new, modern and clean and staff were all very helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely Staff

description: Welcome to our award winning* Ramada Hotel & Suites Coventry.Choose the contemporary four star Ramada Hotel & Suites for home from home luxury in the centre of historic Coventry and Warwickshire. The Hotel is situated just a short 10-minute walk from Coventry rail station, and with flights landing just 11 miles away at Birmingham Airport, you are just a short journey away to perfect relaxation. We’re a perfect location to host meetings and events, centrally located with excellent motorway links and 1 hour from London by train. We can cater for up to 100 people in our 4 bright and modern meeting rooms, all fully air conditioned with complimentary wireless internet access. In May 2013 the hotel will be premiering its fully refubished new look conference & events floor (enquire for full details).With 166 bedrooms, 44 executive apartment suites & a secure four storey car park available, complimented by our award winning* onsite authentic Italian Restaurant - 'Stresa', we are the hotel of choice for both business & leisure guests alike. Ramada Hotel & Suites Coventry, is located closer to Birmingham’s NEC & LG arena than Birmingham City & within a 40 minute drive radius away from the historic towns of Birmingham, Tamworth, Kenilworth, Leamington-Spa, Warwick, Stratford-Upon-Avon and Oxford.* Awards: 2008 Godiva Award Best Hotel, 2011 & 2012 Customer loyalty Award (Wyndham Hotel Group), 2012 Quality breakfast award (Visit Britain), 2013 Gold 2 star champion sustainability award (Sustainable Restaurant Association).
